timeline.event: Richard Henry Lee proposes independence resolution
timeline.significance: Lee's resolution sets independence debate in motion

timeline.event: Committee of Five appointed to draft declaration
timeline.significance: Committee tasked with drafting formal declaration

timeline.details: Jefferson writes first draft in his rented rooms

timeline.location: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania State House Assembly Room
timeline.details: Jefferson's draft presented for Congressional review
timeline.significance: This is what Trumbull's painting depicts, not the signing

timeline.location: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania State House Assembly Room
timeline.significance: Actual vote for independence (Adams thought this would be celebrated)

timeline.event: Congress approves final text of Declaration
timeline.location: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania State House Assembly Room
timeline.details: Final wording approved after amendments and debate
timeline.significance: Text finalized for printing and public announcement

timeline.details: First printing of Declaration for distribution

timeline.event: First public reading by John Nixon

Read per Washington's General Orders to all brigades

timeline.details: King George III statue pulled down after Declaration reading

timeline.location: Assembly Room, Pennsylvania State House, Philadelphia

timeline.significance: The signing ceremony portrayed in the game

timeline.event: John Hancock signs first as President

timeline.legend_note: 'King George will read that' is popular legend

First printing showing all signer names
